questions.question: How does SZ-2 achieve its superior potential for uranyl ion removal?
questions.answer: Through its enhanced stability and elevated porosity.

questions.question: Why is SZ-1 considered one of the most stable MOF materials in fuming acids?
questions.answer: Because it can survive in a variety of fuming acids including aqua regia, oleum, concentrated HNO3, and HCl.

questions.question: What makes SZ-3 unique among porous MOF materials?
questions.answer: It is the only porous MOF material reported to survive in aqua regia.

questions.question: How was the uranium uptake mechanism in SZ-2 elucidated?
questions.answer: Through integrated analysis of X-ray absorption near edge structure (XANES) and extended X-ray absorption fine structure (EXAFS).

questions.question: What is the significance of the Zr5P8 cluster in SZ-1?
questions.answer: It is a previously unknown eight-connected cluster that contributes to the framework's stability and structure.

questions.question: What is the impact of the ligand distortion reduction in SZ-3?
questions.answer: It helps achieve both high porosity and ultrastability in fuming acids.

questions.question: What is the role of molecular dynamics simulations in understanding uranyl uptake in SZ-2?
questions.answer: They provide a microscopic picture of the binding with atomic details, supporting the proposed ion-exchange mechanism.

questions.question: What strategy was used to overcome the crystallization and designability issues in zirconium phosphonate frameworks?
questions.answer: Utilizing a tetra-phosphonate ligand with a sterically demanding spacer and ionothermal synthesis to modify crystallization kinetics.
